title: Higher Diploma in Science in Computing

mimlos.text: Design and implement object-oriented software solutions using industry-standard programming languages
Apply software development methodologies to manage the software development lifecycle
Evaluate and select appropriate data structures and algorithms for specific problem domains
Demonstrate proficiency in version control and collaborative development practices

assessments.title: Programming Project
assessments.notes: Individual software development project with viva presentation

readingList.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
readingList.author: Robert C. Martin

mimlos.text: Apply object-oriented design principles and patterns to software architecture
Analyse requirements and create UML models for complex software systems
Implement and test software using test-driven development practices
Evaluate software quality using appropriate metrics and refactoring techniques
Design normalised relational database schemas using entity-relationship modelling
Implement and query databases using SQL
Evaluate database performance and apply indexing strategies

assessments.title: Database Design Project
assessments.notes: Design and implement a database for a given scenario

mimlos.text: Create responsive web interfaces using HTML5, CSS3, and modern frameworks
Implement client-side functionality using JavaScript and DOM manipulation
Apply accessibility standards and usability principles to web design

modules.title: Computer Architecture, Operating Systems and Networks

mimlos.text: Explain the architecture and operation of modern computer systems
Configure and manage operating system services and processes
Design and implement network configurations using TCP/IP protocols
Apply Scrum and Kanban methodologies to manage software development projects
Implement continuous integration and deployment pipelines
Collaborate effectively in cross-functional agile teams
Evaluate and improve team processes using agile retrospectives
Research, design and implement a substantial software solution addressing a real-world problem
Document and present technical work to professional standards
Critically evaluate the solution against requirements and industry best practices
Demonstrate independent learning and project management skills

assessments.title: Capstone Deliverable
assessments.notes: Final project with demonstration and viva

mimlos.text: Apply computing skills in a professional workplace environment
Demonstrate professional conduct and workplace communication skills
Reflect critically on workplace learning experiences and professional development

assessments.title: Reflective Portfolio
assessments.notes: Weekly reflections and final summary report

mimlos.text: Conduct independent research on a computing topic of professional relevance
Apply research methodologies to investigate computing problems
Communicate research findings through written and oral presentation
Apply statistical analysis techniques to large datasets using Python and R
Design and implement data pipelines for ETL processes
Create effective data visualizations to communicate insights
Evaluate data quality and apply appropriate cleaning techniques

assessments.title: Data Analysis Project
assessments.notes: End-to-end data analysis project with presentation

mimlos.text: Implement supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms
Evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics and validation techniques
Apply feature engineering and selection techniques to improve model accuracy
Deploy machine learning models using industry-standard frameworks

assessments.title: ML Pipeline Project
assessments.notes: Build and deploy an ML solution for a real-world problem

assessments.title: Algorithm Implementations
assessments.notes: Implement core ML algorithms from scratch

readingList.author: Aurélien Géron
readingList.title: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow

mimlos.text: Design and implement game mechanics using industry-standard game engines
Apply game design patterns and architecture principles
Implement game physics, AI behaviours and user input systems
Optimize game performance for target platforms

assessments.title: Game Development Project
assessments.notes: Develop a complete game with documentation and presentation

assessments.title: Technical Prototypes
assessments.notes: Weekly mini-game prototypes demonstrating specific mechanics

readingList.author: Jesse Schell
readingList.title: The Art of Game Design: A Book of Lenses

mimlos.text: Design interactive experiences using user-centred design methodologies
Create 2D/3D assets and animations for interactive applications
Implement audio-visual feedback systems for enhanced user engagement
Evaluate interactive experiences through user testing and iteration

assessments.title: Interactive Experience Project
assessments.notes: Design and develop an interactive media experience with user testing

assessments.title: Design Portfolio
assessments.notes: Curated portfolio of design work and process documentation

plos.text: Design, develop and test software applications using object-oriented programming principles and industry-standard development practices
Apply software engineering methodologies to plan, manage and deliver software projects within professional contexts
Design and implement database solutions using relational database management systems and SQL
Create responsive and accessible web applications using modern web technologies and frameworks
Demonstrate understanding of computer architecture, operating systems and network fundamentals
Work effectively in agile software development teams, applying iterative development practices
Research, design and implement a substantial software project demonstrating integration of learned skills
Communicate technical concepts effectively through documentation and presentations

versions.label: Full-time
versions.deliveryNotes: Primary delivery through on-campus lectures and labs with supplementary online materials.
versions.onlineProctoredExamsNotes: All exams are conducted on campus.

versions.label: Part-time Blended
versions.deliveryNotes: Blended delivery with evening/weekend on-campus sessions and significant online component. On-campus sessions typically Saturday mornings.
versions.onlineProctoredExamsNotes: Exams conducted on campus at scheduled times.

versions.label: Part-time Fully Online
versions.deliveryNotes: Fully online delivery with live synchronous sessions scheduled in evenings (Irish time). All materials available asynchronously. No on-campus attendance required.
versions.onlineProctoredExamsNotes: All exams are conducted online using Proctorio proctoring software. Students must have webcam and stable internet connection. Alternative arrangements available for students with accessibility needs.
